::: {#hero-heading}

 Since 2009 I have been leading the Latin American Pollen Database (LAPD) and I have been part of [Neotoma Paleoecology Database and Community](https://www.neotomadb.org/people). I've facilitated the upload of pollen records to [Neotoma](https://www.neotomadb.org/) from Latin America, and also from Europe and the Indo-Pacific region, together with several collaborators associated to the European Pollen Database and Neotoma.

Check out the website here [Latin American Pollen Database](https://www.latinamericapollendb.com/) where you can also find an [interactive map](https://uvagis.maps.arcgis.com/apps/webappviewer/index.html?id=7403398bce354f1bb6a163ff0f3a4ea1) showing over 1400 fossil pollen records and 4600 modern pollen samples. I compiled this overview during my PhD: [Flantua et al. 2015](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0034666715001773)

The LAPD initiated some time ago and here you can read more about its [history](https://www.latinamericapollendb.com/?page_id=14)
